### buildCopyFromRegs() {#aae7d70f087262ba4f7657f564ce0ca38}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void buildCopyFromRegs (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineirbuilder">MachineIRBuilder</a> &amp; B, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; OrigRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; Regs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> LLTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> PartLLT, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/isd/argflagsty">ISD::ArgFlagsTy</a> Flags)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a sequence of instructions to combine pieces split into register typed values to the original IR value.

<code>OrigRegs</code> contains the destination value registers of type <code>LLTy</code>, and <code>Regs</code> contains the legalized pieces with type <code>PartLLT</code>. This is used for incoming values (physregs to vregs).

Definition at line <a href="#l00372">372</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp">CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### buildCopyToRegs() {#a2e9d3565509fb5cd3e136c0fa68ad5b2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void buildCopyToRegs (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineirbuilder">MachineIRBuilder</a> &amp; B, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; DstRegs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> SrcReg, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> SrcTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> PartTy, unsigned ExtendOp=TargetOpcode::G&#95;ANYEXT)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Create a sequence of instructions to expand the value in <code>SrcReg</code> (of type <code>SrcTy</code>) to the types in <code>DstRegs</code> (of type <code>PartTy</code>).

<code>ExtendOp</code> should contain the type of scalar value extension if necessary.

This is used for outgoing values (vregs to physregs)

Definition at line <a href="#l00557">557</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp">CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isCopyCompatibleType() {#ad4d564b29ec78229d8d9ab0970db529d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool isCopyCompatibleType (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> SrcTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> DstTy)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if we can use a basic COPY instruction between the two types.

We&#39;re currently building on top of the infrastructure using <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mvt">MVT</a>, which loses pointer information in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign">CCValAssign</a>. We accept copies from physical registers that have been reported as integers if it&#39;s to an equivalent sized pointer <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a>.

Definition at line <a href="#l01369">1369</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/calllowering-cpp">CallLowering.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For incoming arguments (physregs to vregs), we could have values in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// physregs (or memlocs) which we want to extract and copy to vregs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// During this, we might have to deal with the LLT being split across</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multiple regs, so we have to record this information for later.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we have outgoing args, then we have the opposite case. We have a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// vreg with an LLT which we want to assign to a physical location, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we might have to record that the value has to be split later.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// E.g. passing an s128 on AArch64.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Assigner.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valueassigner/#ab1caf846fc79aa5976216a32724c9e10">assignArg</a>(i, CurVT, NewVT, NewVT, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign/#a2b78fd53da0b5df7bc4eacf7df556a45a8b73d77b9e54663c2e80a48d0917dce1">CCValAssign::Full</a>, Args&#91;i&#93;,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Stores thunks for outgoing register assignments. This is used so we delay</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// generating register copies until mem loc assignments are done. We do this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so that if the target is using the delayed stack protector feature, we can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// find the split point of the block accurately. E.g. if we have:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// G&#95;STORE %val, %memloc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// $x0 = COPY %foo</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// $x1 = COPY %bar</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CALL func</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ... then the split point for the block will correctly be at, and including,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the copy to $x0. If instead the G&#95;STORE instruction immediately precedes</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the CALL, then we&#39;d prematurely choose the CALL as the split point, thus</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// generating a split block with a CALL that uses undefined physregs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector</a>&lt;std::function&lt;void()&gt;&gt; DelayedOutgoingRegAssignments;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i = 0, j = 0; i != NumArgs; ++i, ++j) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(j &lt; ArgLocs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a1c479a8c434377c2b8cb056bdfdfc201">size</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Skipped too many arg locs&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign">CCValAssign</a> &amp;VA = ArgLocs&#91;j&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(VA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign/#aad6f82d490b016e27d3a4cd7ab7efdf6">getValNo</a>() == i &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Location doesn&#39;t correspond to current arg&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (VA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ccvalassign/#a5378385666bd865565fcf8407fcc36f9">needsCustom</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><Highlight kind="normal">      std::function&lt;void()&gt; Thunk;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumArgRegs = Handler.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valuehandler/#abcdfa9adfee0c237b61d8708183f1006">assignCustomValue</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="normal">          Args&#91;i&#93;, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab9c6b351507d3c0730f4290919d43a12">ArrayRef</a>(ArgLocs).slice(j), &amp;Thunk);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Thunk)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="normal">        DelayedOutgoingRegAssignments.emplace&#95;back(Thunk);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!NumArgRegs)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="normal">      j += (NumArgRegs - 1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AllocaAddressSpace = MF.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction/#a82dd10b626a629b9bb7d32d53a8e0884">getDataLayout</a>().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout/#a9748c769cedc926c41cd95183fd7abd4">getAllocaAddrSpace</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> NewLLT = Handler.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/calllowering/valuehandler/#a7e3835a69edc9dcb7eed477ae19a72cb">isIncomingArgumentHandler</a>() ? <Link id="l01363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1363"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Check if we can use a basic COPY instruction between the two types.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1364"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1365"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We&#39;re currently building on top of the infrastructure using MVT, which loses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1366"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pointer information in the CCValAssign. We accept copies from physical</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1367"><Highlight kind="comment">/// registers that have been reported as integers if it&#39;s to an equivalent sized</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1368"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pointer LLT.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1369" lineLink="#ad4d564b29ec78229d8d9ab0970db529d"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="#ad4d564b29ec78229d8d9ab0970db529d">isCopyCompatibleType</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> SrcTy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> DstTy) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1372"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1373"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SrcTy.getSizeInBits() != DstTy.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt/#a956ffd0de93798f523683b447646dd92">getSizeInBits</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1374"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1375"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1376"><Highlight kind="normal">  SrcTy = SrcTy.getScalarType();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1377"><Highlight kind="normal">  DstTy = DstTy.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt/#ae4165ca7bcbee300d5e9c065adcc1415">getScalarType</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
